title: All Bran Cereal, Original,1.14 Pound (Pack of 5)
features: Pack of five, 18.3-ounce boxes of Original All Bran Cereal
Natural wheat bran cereal sweetened with sugar
A good source of 13 vitamins and minerals; low in fat
40 percent of your daily fiber needs
description: Kellogg's(R) All-Bran 7-Day Promise: It's a small change that can make a world of difference in the way you feel. All you have to do is enjoy one serving of your favorite Kellogg's All-Bran products once a day for 7 days. That's all. Seriously. It's that simple.

With 40% of your daily recommended fiber, this wholesome wheat-bran cereal is a great way to start your day. All-Bran offers 4 grams of protein per serving with zero trans or saturated fats, zero cholesterol, and low sodium.
All-Bran is fortified with the vitamins and minerals:

Calcium carbonate, vitamin C (sodium ascorbate and ascorbic acid), reduced iron, niacinamide, vitamin B6 (pyridoxine hydrochloride), vitamin B2 (riboflavin), folic acid, vitamin B1 (thiamin hydrochloride), vitamin A palmitate, vitamin B12, vitamin D.
Enjoy one serving of All-Bran fiber cereal every day for one week to see if you feel lighter and more energetic in just 7 days...
Day 1: You’re about to take an important step toward better colon health.
You’re about to take an important step toward better colon health.
Day 2: Remember to add fiber to your diet gradually. A good guide is to add one serving of All-Bran cereal a day.
Remember to add fiber to your diet gradually. A good guide is to add one serving of All-Bran cereal a day.
Day 3: Drink plenty of water as you add fiber to your diet to help the fiber do its job.
Drink plenty of water as you add fiber to your diet to help the fiber do its job.
Day 4: Adding more fiber in your diet is getting easier.
Adding more fiber in your diet is getting easier.
Day 5: If your not feeling lighter yet take heart, it’s worth the wait.
If your not feeling lighter yet take heart, it’s worth the wait.
Day 6: Keep up the good work, you're well on your way.
Keep up the good work, you're well on your way.
Day 7: By now, you should be feeling lighter and you probably feel as if you have more energy.
By now, you should be feeling lighter and you probably feel as if you have more energy.
Day 8 and Beyond: At this point you know how to make fiber-rich foods a part of your lifestyle.
At this point you know how to make fiber-rich foods a part of your lifestyle.
The studies are clear--fiber can help promote weight loss and healthier eating patterns, while increasing overall health:
Fiber takes longer to chew and slows down the rate at which we eat--giving our bodies a chance to let us know when we are full.
Fiber takes longer to chew and slows down the rate at which we eat--giving our bodies a chance to let us know when we are full.
With fewer calories and greater bulk, high-fiber foods help us feel fuller for longer.
With fewer calories and greater bulk, high-fiber foods help us feel fuller for longer.
Fiber helps keep the digestive tract clean and healthy decreasing risk of intestinal disease.
Fiber helps keep the digestive tract clean and healthy decreasing risk of intestinal disease.

Fiber-rich diets can help lower 'bad' cholesterol, lower blood pressure, and help control blood sugar levels.  Up the Fiber in your diet with these great recipes: Cinnamon Roll BiscuitsThese delicious cinnamon roll biscuits are enriched with a cup of All-Bran cereal for a natural boost of fiber. (Of course, that's not the reason you're going to love them.)Prep Time: 35 minutes Total Time: 1 hour Servings: 12 Ingredients 3 cups all-purpose flour2 tablespoons granulated sugar4-1/2 teaspoons baking powder1 teaspoon salt1 cup butter, divided1 cup Kellogg's All-Bran Original cereal1-1/2 cups milk1/2 cup packed brown sugar1-tablespoon cinnamon1/2 cup caramel ice cream toppingDirections In a large bowl combine flour, granulated sugar, baking powder, and salt. Using a pastry blender, cut in 1/2 cup cold butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Make a well in center of flour mixture.In a medium bowl combine KELLOGG'S ALL-BRAN ORIGINAL cereal with milk; let stand 6 minutes or until cereal softens. Stir into flour mixture until dough just forms a ball.On a lightly floured surface, knead dough gently 10 to 12 strokes. Roll or pat dough on lightly floured surface into a 14 X 10-inch rectangle.Combine brown sugar and cinnamon. Spread dough with 1/2 cup softened butter; sprinkle with cinnamon mixture.Roll up in a spiral, starting from the long side. Pinch seam to seal.With a knife, cut into 12 thick slices. Arrange slices, cut side down, in a 13 X 9 X 2-inch baking pan coated with cooking spray. Chicken Tomato Pilaf  Keep this recipe on hand for any time you need a delicious, simple and nutritious one-dish meal. This family-pleasing casserole is bursting with chicken, tomatoes, mushrooms and rice. Serve with a crisp green salad and you're done. Prep Time: 20 minutes Total Time: 55 minutes Servings: 5 Ingredients 1 jar (2 1/2 ounces/1/2 cup) sliced mushrooms, drained, reserving liquid1/4 cup chopped onions1 small clove garlic, chopped2 tablespoons vegetable oil1/4 teaspoon saltDash pepper1/8 teaspoon thyme leaves1 can (16 ounces/2 cups) whole peeled tomatoes, undrained1/3 cup Kellogg's All-Bran Original cerealor Kellogg's All-Bran Bran Buds cereal1/4 cup uncooked, long grain, white rice2 cups cubed, cooked chickenDirections In large fry pan, cook mushrooms, onions and garlic in oil until tender, stirring constantly. Stir in reserved mushroom liquid, salt, pepper, thyme and tomatoes. Cut tomatoes into pieces with spoon. Bring to boil. Stir in KELLOGG'S ALL-BRAN cereal, rice and chicken.Cover pan tightly and simmer about 35 minutes or until rice is tender, stirring occasionally. Sprinkle each serving with snipped fresh parsley and additional cereal, if desired. Serve hot.Beef Tomato Pilaf: Substitute 1/2 pound lean ground beef, browned and drained for the chicken. About KelloggKellogg Company is a leading producer of cereal and convenience foods--a company you can rely on for great-tasting, high quality foods. Kellogg was founded in 1906, in Battle Creek, Michigan. For more than 100 years, innovation and their commitment to being the best has guided the company. From being the first company to offer premiums in cereal boxes to being the first to fortify the cereals, Kellogg has historically been a leader in industry, innovation, and marketing.The founder, W.K. Kellogg, had a strong commitment to nutrition, health, and quality. His vision continues to drive improvement in the products and processes, with the goal of providing great-tasting, nutritious products that meet the most rigorous quality standards.With more than 100 ready-to-eat cereals around the world, consumers count on Kellogg for great-tasting, convenient, and affordable choices that meet their nutrition needs.

Keep this recipe on hand for any time you need a delicious, simple and nutritious one-dish meal. This family-pleasing casserole is bursting with chicken, tomatoes, mushrooms and rice. Serve with a crisp green salad and you're done.

In large fry pan, cook mushrooms, onions and garlic in oil until tender, stirring constantly. Stir in reserved mushroom liquid, salt, pepper, thyme and tomatoes. Cut tomatoes into pieces with spoon. Bring to boil. Stir in KELLOGG'S ALL-BRAN cereal, rice and chicken.

In large fry pan, cook mushrooms, onions and garlic in oil until tender, stirring constantly. Stir in reserved mushroom liquid, salt, pepper, thyme and tomatoes. Cut tomatoes into pieces with spoon. Bring to boil. Stir in KELLOGG'S ALL-BRAN cereal, rice and chicken.
Cover pan tightly and simmer about 35 minutes or until rice is tender, stirring occasionally. Sprinkle each serving with snipped fresh parsley and additional cereal, if desired. Serve hot.
Cover pan tightly and simmer about 35 minutes or until rice is tender, stirring occasionally. Sprinkle each serving with snipped fresh parsley and additional cereal, if desired. Serve hot.
Substitute 1/2 pound lean ground beef, browned and drained for the chicken.

Kellogg Company is a leading producer of cereal and convenience foods--a company you can rely on for great-tasting, high quality foods. Kellogg was founded in 1906, in Battle Creek, Michigan. For more than 100 years, innovation and their commitment to being the best has guided the company. From being the first company to offer premiums in cereal boxes to being the first to fortify the cereals, Kellogg has historically been a leader in industry, innovation, and marketing.

The founder, W.K. Kellogg, had a strong commitment to nutrition, health, and quality. His vision continues to drive improvement in the products and processes, with the goal of providing great-tasting, nutritious products that meet the most rigorous quality standards.
With more than 100 ready-to-eat cereals around the world, consumers count on Kellogg for great-tasting, convenient, and affordable choices that meet their nutrition needs.
